column4: Does anybody know why my usb stick won't show up on my desktop? (Using LXDE and Ubuntu 10.04 Server) I can't mount the device fine manually, but I'd like this to be automated...
*I can mount the device
can you unplug and plug your usb-stick again and type "dmesg" in the terminal?
wait a sec
I have attached my usb disk (which shows the same behavior, lack of icons on LXDE desktop): http://pastebin.com/iEWnWmzk
Any ideas?
what file system got your usb stick?
NTFS
: My usb stick uses FAT32, same issue there
I believe I lack the proper triggers to make the system mount the device automatically and put an icon on desktop. Maybe it's because I installed from a minimal system?
is "/etc/auto.master" configured properly?
There is no /etc/auto.master file
There is no autofs or automount installed
is automounting working with other usb sticks?
Nope
Not even with cdrom i guess :)
you could try usbmount http://usbmount.alioth.debian.org/
!info usbmount
Should I just install this?
What is the package that gets installed with a normal desktop ubuntu system?
the package is in the repo http://packages.ubuntu.com/natty/usbmount
